response.answer_text: I’m bored, so let’s give it a go. According to the calculation rule, decision and multiple goes first, add and abstract goes after. And do it from left to right. Thus, 2–2*3+3 Do the multiple first, then you got 2–6+3 And then you can do the abstract and add now, which leads to the answer -1 Just in case you don’t know what that mean, it is called negative one, it’s a negative number , it is a number below zero. Got it? Peace out~~

I get the strong sense that this and so many many others like it are not sincere questions but more of an opportunity for the asker to kill some time while having a laugh at the expense of the well meaning Quorans who repeat for the umpteenth time the rules of “PODMAS” or maybe “BEMDSA” if someone is particularly creative. These questions are repetitive and boring and anyone who needs to ask them is too young to sit at a computer, log in to Quora and type them out. Those who answer them, while well meaning, would have to admit to either being slightly gullible or having a strong competitive desire to win the prize for answering the most questions. Here’s my question. Is there one?
